conclusion: Analyze interaction between magnetic field, wire, and spring scales to derive B.
Two spring scales above a horizontal wire ab in a magnetic field perpendicular to the paper.
Wire ab is in a magnetic field perpendicular to the paper, direction indicated by arrow.
Force on wire with current I is calculated using F = BIL.
Reading F1 on spring scale when current flows from a to b, F1 = BIL.
When current is reversed and doubled, force becomes F2 = -BIL.
F2 is equal to F1 in magnitude but opposite in direction.
F1 = BIL and F2 = -BIL implies BIL = -BIL.
Correct equation is F1 = BIL and F2 = 2BIL, force doubles with current.
Solving for B gives B = F1 / (IL).
